intro: Dalbergaria fuscihirta, commonly known as the red-hot poker, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive, spiky inflorescences. The plant features palmate leaves and produces vibrant red or orange flowers that bloom in summer. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can thrive in well-drained soils with full sun exposure. Dalbergaria fuscihirta is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
